intro: Cynoglossum amabile f. ruberum, commonly known as the red-flowered bellflower, is a cultivar of the common bellflower. It is characterized by its striking red petals that contrast with its blue-green foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces showy, bell-shaped flowers in late summer. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil. This cultivar is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and easy maintenance.
